12232.title: Protected True Dragon Character

122321.content:
Name: Valareos
Race: True Dragon
Gender: Male
Orientation: Bisexual

Description: Generally Red scaled, with orange striping. Chest and underbelly are a platinum color. Wing membrane is same color as the orange stripings.

Personality: Outgoing and a bit of a flirt, Valareos holds friendship as very important to him. Those he considers friends he will bend over backwards for, and those that hurt his friends, he will go after with a vengeance. Though he is a flirt, he does put himself out to find a casual relationship, preferring to spend his interest on those who seek him out. He never allows his personal feelings to get in the way of his responsibilities in First Hope

Position within First Hope: Mayor



Currently no personal storyline to add, Character is open for introduction in other RPs

choices: Not good. Devin didn't really think much of him.

131.content:
Each day was generally the same.

He didn't mind- in fact, it was a bit embarrassing to enjoy a desk job so much. What could he say? Weren't you supposed to hate your job? At least, that's what all his friends insisted- or, aquantinces. It's not like he had many friends. Devin wasn't exactly sure who he considered a friend, but the most obvious option was in the next room over, after all. He contemplated it- did he consider his boss his friend? Did his boss consider him a friend? Well... He supposed all he knew what was he certainly felt about Mayor Valareos.

Working as his secretary was... Interesting, to say the least. While he loved his job, his feelings towards Valaeros were...
131.title: A Simple Desk Job

choices: Continue on your way to find the late messenger
Take a Pamphlet to read later
1312.content:
The Mayor was fair, at least.. and he held himself up as a champion of the little guy. And he always tried to kept his promise. For a politician, this was a rare thing in deed.

"Devin!" The male red's voice boomed out from the office. Devin quickly moved to the arched doorway. "You need something, Val?"

Most Mayors in the past required others to use some sort of title of office when addressing, and Valareos did require such for official proceedings.. but during a normal day of business, he encouraged his workers to address him by a familiar... to remind everyone that he was still just a dragon like anyone else.

"Devin, I was supposed to get the documents for that land we acquiring for the hatchery expansion, but it seems their delivery agent is running late. I need you to find those documents and get them back here as soon as you can. I am wanting to close this deal by the end of the week."

Devin gave an enthusiastic nod. "You got it boss!" This was the main part of his duties, as a runner for the Mayor, a job he was rather good at. As he made his way out of the office, he saw a single wyvern handing out pamphlets to all that passed.
1312.title: Good. Maybe he was Devin's friend after all.

choices: Aria lands safely and continues on
Aria lands on top of someone
Aria's tail is grabbed by the maw of the earth dragon she had jumped on
132.content:
"Excuse me! Coming through!"

Aria made her way through the bustle of the crowds, carrying with her a parcel she held onto as if her life depended on it. Not that the Mayor Valareos would kill her if she lost it.. she just would lose her job and never get another decent wage again. The crowds today were bigger than usual, having been the final day of the festival. Everyone was trying to find themselves a place to watch the fireworks tonight.

She rolled her eyes as she continued to run, dodging one dragon after another, but in front of her, two earth dragons were just... standing there as if they owned the place. Gritting her teeth, she ran right towards them and jumped at the last minute, using the larger of the two as a platform to launch herself off of.

Soaring above the crowds, she adjusted her body to control where she landed, as best as she could.

15.content:
"Energy Levels... Check..."

"Coordinates... Locked..."

"Alright Ambassador... you are our third attempt to communicate with the world on the other side. Reports we have received is the alien world is inhabited by creatures claimed to be dragons.. and they certainly look the part. We don't know what happened to the first two attempts.. other than there was a huge energy backlash from the portal. We were forced to find a new portal coordinate to lock onto. Luckily for us, you are expendable. Succeed in this, you come back a hero. Fail.. Well.. you were on your third strike, your lucky we didn't just toss you out of the city and be done with it. Good luck."

"Activating portal...."

The feeling of being torn apart was unbearable, like every atom in the body was being stripped away, and the Ambassador could feel every last bit of it. Suddenly, flashes of light, as if travelling through a tunnel explainable in any human terms.. It was beautiful, but scary at the same time. Suddenly, the feel of grass could be felt, as the Ambassadors mind tried to pull itself together, to remember who he.. or she.. was...

info.brief_description: Interactive Story based on the Visual Novel "Angels with Scaly Wings". Spoiler Free.
info.description:
Angels with Scaly Wings is a Romance Adventure Visual Novel available on Steam (http://store.steampowered.com/app/571880/)

This interactive is based on the world portrayed in that Visual Novel, but it will not involve the same location, or same characters. Why? I will be wanting to avoid spoilers at all costs so those that decide to try the game can still get the full enjoyment of it.

This means that some background information, or events portrayed here is inspired by AWSW, but is not the same. As such, there are a few rules that need to be made clear.

1. No Spoilers! Enough said.. I will delete any posts I believe is a spoiler to the game, whether it was intentional or not.

2. Do not use characters from the game! On top of the No Spoiler rule, there is also the fact some of the game characters are cameos, and as such are owned by the people who those cameos were for. It would be very rude of us to include them in story lines and actions that are against the creators view of that character. Exceptions will be if the owners of those cameo characters wrote in the storyline their permission, AND can be properly verified that they do indeed own that character

3. Protected characters are Protected If a player writes a new character and denotes it as a protected character, then that person is the only one that can write a response FOR that character. That doesn't mean that you cant jump into a storyline that is being written and interact with that character though.. provided it makes sense. Just leave room for the player to respond as their character. See Below for more information

4. There is only one human in the game. If that human has been identified in a story thread, then there is no changing that human. If you want to add a different human, pick a story thread that doesn't have the human introduced yet. On this world, humans are considered a myth, to some a deity. Just keep in mind how humans may react to a dragon

5. Technology Flat screen televisions and computers exist, There are no ships, there is no mobile phone use, but there is a device called an Ixomen Sphere that does most of what a modern mobile phone does. There is no knowledge of any continent beyond the one you are on. For purposes of this story, there is no mass transport other than flying or walking. Beyond that, you can assume a technology level as one would expect for modern times

5. There are 5 Dragon races. There is room for customization, but try to keep it so one can make it generally within one of these 5. They are based on the dragons you can generally interact with in the game, though I have taken liberties with some of the dragon race names. Dragons either have a breath weapon of fire, or no breath weapon.

6. Vore As much as I enjoy a good vore scene, for storyline purposes, eating another sentient being is a crime. It happens, but usually by dragons who contract a mental illness that reverts them to a feral state of mind. I am not saying don't have vore in your story, I'm just saying make sure you take into consideration the consequences.

7. Gender and OrientationNo limits. Everyone's sexuality is unique, and it is all welcome.

The Dragon Races are as follows:

Earth Dragons: These dragons are quadruped, heavily scaled dragons known for their strength and toughness. They have vestigial wings that act as extra armor for their back, and can be moved with some effort, however they do not support flight. Their tail end comes to a club like appearance, and can be used as such.

Wyverns: One of the two variety of Fliers, they do not have any forelegs. However, they are very dexterous and can walk while balancing objects on their wingtips. Their feet serve the same purpose as hands in other species, and can be used just as well as hands. The tail comes to a curved tip that can be used for catching fish.

True Dragons: The second variety of Flier, these are the ones that most resemble Western Dragons. They combine the strength and toughness of the Earth Dragons, with the flight ability of the Wyverns, however they have a simple tapered tail, and their claws lack the dexterity of the Wyverns. Some are able to walk on two legs, others can not.

Raptors: Also known as the Runners, these flightless dragons walk on two legs and can run extremely fast. In addition, their hands are the most dexterous of all the dragons, and as such are usually used for jobs that require fine motor skills.

Draconians: These creatures most resemble lizardmen. While they mostly have scales, a few have been known to have fur instead. They are bipedal, and though not as fast as the Raptors, they are more solidly built with fairly dexterous hands. This makes them ideal for the largest variety of jobs of all the Dragons.

More Information for Protected Characters

Ideally, having a protected character allows that character to interact directly with a writer, adding more storyline and cooperative effort. In a perfect world, a person would not write a "Forced action" for a protected character, unless it is something obvious.

For example, a person may have a Protected Character named Faamil who works as a barkeep at the Drained Dragon. You could order a drink from Faamil and have him deliver it to you without needing to interact with Faamil's creator, but asking Faamil about his favorite music would be something you would have to allow Faamil's character to answer.

More importantly, you couldn't in your storline claim Faamil is killed, or becomes a criminal, or his bar burns down without his permission, and any permission granted is LIMITED to just that one storyline. This gives Faamils creator some say in how his character is used.

On the same token, if you do decide to create a Protected Character, we ask you remain active, introduce your character in other storylines, basically our Protected Characters act as sort of GMs to help other storylines foward if they are stalled

Enough rules then? On to the Village of First Hope
